verbose_text: A retrospective examination of the NA sequence revealed that the assigned N-terminal residue (Cys281) is preceded by a serine residue (Ser280), allowing for the inclusion of Ser280 (+87.0320 Da) together with a change of the Cys281 modification from a double BPL attachment (+144.0423 Da) to carbamidomethylation (+57.0215 Da) results in a mass shift of 0.0112 Da, which reduces mass error from 7 to 1 ppm.
